speaker: LARKEN
line: Name please?

speaker: AMY
line: Amy Jacobs.

speaker: LARKEN
line: Fill out your address card. May I have the next on in line?

speaker: LARKEN
line: Carl, I need a reload.

speaker: LARKEN
line: Hey, Carl. Hey! I need more film.

speaker: WADE
line: I haven’t loaded it yet.

speaker: LARKEN
line: Why you even bother coming in if you’re not going to do your job?

speaker: WADE
line: Nobody’s going to spoil us.

speaker: SISTER
line: Amy? Amy! Mom!

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Hurry up with those drinks, Lucy. We’re backing up. What are you doing? These are regular. They all ordered large. What …?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: What happened?

speaker: LUCY
line: Nobody’s going to spoil us … Nobody’s going to spoil us … Nobody … Nobody’s going …. Nobody’s going to spoil us … Nobody’s going to spoil … Nobody’s going to spoil … Nobody’s going to spoil us …

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m looking for the agent in charge.

speaker: OFFICER
line: And you are?

speaker: MULDER
line: Special Agent Mulder.

speaker: OFFICER
line: I’ll let him know you’re here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Jacobs? I’m Fox Mulder. I’m with the FBI. I’m sorry about your daughter.

speaker: MRS. JACOBS
line: It’s her birthday on Tuesday.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re going to do everything we can to find her.

speaker: MRS. JACOBS
line: Who could do such a thing? Who could take somebody who wasn’t theirs?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know you must be feeling …

speaker: MRS. JACOBS
line: I’m sorry … but how could you really know how I feel?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: It’s blood. Amy had a nosebleed. Her little sister said it happened when the kidnapper put his hand over her mouth. We’re running it anyway. Walt Eubanks, Special Agent in Charge.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fox Mulder. Any leads on a suspect?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: A vague description from the sister. Hair and fiber pulled some promising bits but he didn’t leave any prints here or in the flower beds out front.

speaker: MULDER
line: The neighbors?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Nobody saw anything. Not a car – nothing. It was someone who knew her – that much we can figure. He knew right where he was going.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I bet that he didn’t know her so well or else he wouldn’t have been so bold.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Either way, we’re pretty much chasing our tails until something or someone turns on this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about this woman at the restaurant?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: You heard?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that’s why I came down here.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Seems like a pretty thin lead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mind if I talk to her?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Hey, save me the time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Great. Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought you missed your flight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were delayed in DC. I tried you on your cell phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: I forgot it. I left in kind of a hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your message said something about a kidnapping?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, 15 year old girl, Amy Jacobs was taken from her

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is she here?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. They haven’t found her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are we doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: A 30-year-old woman named Lucy Householder was from some kind of seizure and what her doctors are calling glossolalia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Incoherent speech.

speaker: MULDER
line: Technically, but whether she knew it or not, she was repeating the exact words spoken by Amy’s abductor the exact same time 20 miles across town.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that’s spooky.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s my name, isn’t it? Turns out, Lucy Householder knows a little something about kidnapping herself. When she was eight years old she was taken from her bedroom while her parents were asleep. She was missing for five years until she escaped and someone found her by the side of the road. Apparently, her abductor had kept her locked in a basement the entire time. They never caught him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy? I’m Fox Mulder. This is Dana Scully. We’re with the FBI. We’d like to ask you a few questions.

speaker: LUCY
line: I’d like a cigarette. They won’t let me smoke in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you feeling any better?

speaker: LUCY
line: Yeah, I’m fine. I’d just like a cigarette.

speaker: MULDER
line: A young girl was kidnapped last night. Have you heard anything about that?

speaker: LUCY
line: What are you asking me for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you remember what you were saying last night when you collapsed at work?

speaker: LUCY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You were saying "Nobody’s going to spoil us."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does that mean anything to you?

speaker: LUCY
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you think of any reason why you might have said it?

speaker: LUCY
line: What did I just say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Those were the exact words spoken by the kidnapper to the little girl when he took her last night. So you can see, that under the circumstances, it might seem strange that you …

speaker: LUCY
line: So what’s your point? All of us kidnap victims gotta stick together?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. We just want to find the little girl any way we can, and if you know anything …

speaker: LUCY
line: Look, what I’ve been through all my life I wouldn’t wish on anybody. It doesn’t mean I can make it any better for me or anyone else.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, well thanks for talking to us, Lucy.

speaker: LUCY
line: Yeah.

speaker: LUCY
line: Hey! When do I get out of here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m sure as soon as your doctors feel it’s okay for you to go.

speaker: LUCY
line: No. They say it’s up to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, we can’t hold you here. You’re free to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess she’s not too big on confined spaces.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: You the one that called for a tow?

speaker: WADE
line: No. Not me.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Gary Mosier?

speaker: WADE
line: No. Wrong guy.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: While I’m out here I might as well give you a hand.

speaker: WADE
line: It’s okay. We’ll be fine.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Hey, it looks like you’re in a world of hurt. Blown sidewall. You’re going to need a new tire.

speaker: WADE
line: Yeah. Looks that way.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Got a spare in the trunk?

speaker: WADE
line: Yeah.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Twenty bucks cash. My boss don’t gotta know about it. Have you on the road in five minutes.

speaker: WADE
line: I can’t pay you.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Make it ten. Pop the trunk. Take me five minutes, max.

speaker: WADE
line: Leave me alone!

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Hey, man, what the hell’s your problem?

speaker: WADE
line: Leave me alone! Get out of here!

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Lunatic! Freak!

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Hold on a second. Agent Mulder. Lucy Householder --- you get anywhere on that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m working on it.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: One of my guys says she’s got a criminal record --- prostitution, narcotics convictions. She’s done some time.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn’t surprise me given her history.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: She’s also got a boyfriend doing time for assault and child endangerment. Used to live with him up in the hills. Pretty sketchy characters.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think she’s involved.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Closest thing I got right now to a lead. I can tell them to shift some men …

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Let me follow up on that, okay? Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder… I got something – something weird.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was going over Lucy Householder’s medical work-up and something hit me. Her blood type is O-positive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Forensics lifted two blood types off of her work clothes -- O-positive and B -positive. Two guesses as to what Amy Jacobs’ blood type is.

speaker: MULDER
line: How could it be Amy Jacobs’ blood? Lucy was all the way across town.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know, Mulder, but it begs the question.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Because it matches the victim’s blood type? How many people have B -positive blood, Scully? One in five? That’s got to be hundreds of thousands of people in the local population alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re not talking about the local population. We’re talking about a woman who is tied to this case who had somebody else’s blood on her uniform.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy is a victim, Scully, just like Amy Jacobs. If she’s got any connection to this case that’s the extent of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we’ll know soon enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m running a PCR on her blood to see if there’s a DNA match.

speaker: MULDER
line: Will you do me a favor? Will you keep that under your hat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: ‘Cause I don’t want Lucy Householder treated like a suspect in this case until it’s absolutely certain she is one, okay?

speaker: HENRY
line: Lucy?

speaker: LUCY
line: I’m cold.

speaker: HENRY
line: I brought you another blanket. We should call the doctor.

speaker: LUCY
line: No!

speaker: HENRY
line: Let me see your face. What did you do to yourself?

speaker: LUCY
line: It’s dark. Why is it dark? I can’t see.

speaker: HENRY
line: You hold on now.

speaker: LUCY
line: I can’t see.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s she doing?

speaker: EMS
line: Fine. Blood pressure’s back to normal. Temperature’s back up. She must have gone down the rabbit hole for a while. You should get something to eat soon. Get your blood sugar back up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you say, Lucy? Can I take you to dinner?

speaker: MULDER
line: You feeling better?

speaker: LUCY
line: Better than what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Better than Amy Jacobs?

speaker: LUCY
line: Wouldn’t know.

speaker: MULDER
line: If anybody knows, I’d say you do.

speaker: LUCY
line: I’ve got my own set of problems now, thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’d you scratch your face?

speaker: LUCY
line: Must’ve done it in my sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you using again, Lucy?

speaker: LUCY
line: I’m clean. Passed my test last week. You can ask Henry.

speaker: HENRY
line: With flying colors.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever experienced temporary blindness before?

speaker: LUCY
line: I’ve probably experienced just about everything once or twice. It’s all been pretty temporary.

speaker: MULDER
line: That girl’s in trouble, Lucy.

speaker: LUCY
line: And there’s not a damn thing I can do about it. You understand? I can’t help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you can, Lucy.

speaker: LUCY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that’s something you have to tell me.

speaker: LUCY
line: What can I possibly do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lead us to her.

speaker: LUCY
line: I don’t know where she is. I don’t care. I’m not interested.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that’s too bad, Lucy, because right now I think you’re her best hope.

speaker: LUCY
line: If I’m her best hope then that little girl’s in a hell of a lot more trouble than you think.

speaker: AMY
line: Who are you? What do you want? Why are you doing this? Please … I want to go home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’ve got a ----

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that Lucy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Taken in 1978, the week she was found. She’d been held in the dark so long her eyes were hypersensitive to the light. Whoever held her captive wasn’t very big on conversation, either. She’s 13 years old and can barely string two words together. It’s amazing she’s gotten anywhere in life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, by most yardsticks, she hasn’t, Mulder. Look, I think we’ve got a break in the case. A big one.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: School pictures were mailed out this week to everyone in Amy’s class except Amy. One of Eubanks’s men discovered it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who’s the photographer?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s an outfit called Larken Scholastic. Now, the photographer checked out but his assistant was fired the day after the shoot – a man named Carl Wade.

speaker: MULDER
line: What have you got on him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: DMVs, and old address, but he spent the good part of the past 15 years institutionalized for a bipolar condition. The only thing current we have on him is this photo taken by his employer trying out a new camera.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you shown this picture to Amy’s little sister?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They’re doing it right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m going to take it and show it to Lucy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy, wait.

speaker: LUCY
line: No. I’m done with you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just want to ask you a question. Lucy, wait a second.

speaker: LUCY
line: Don’t touch me. I don’t like to be touched.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: LUCY
line: I was doing okay until this, you know? Figures.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just want to show you a photograph, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: You recognize him don’t you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy?

speaker: LUCY
line: What’s happening to me?

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s probably changed a lot over the last 17 years. Did you even know his name? Carl Wade. He worked as a photographer’s assistant. School pictures mostly. That’s where he saw Amy Jacobs.

speaker: LUCY
line: So what do you want from me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to tell me what you’re going through. It might feel good to tell somebody.

speaker: LUCY
line: I feel like it’s happening all over again.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can actually feel what she’s going through, can’t you?

speaker: LUCY
line: I don’t want to go through this again.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy, she needs your help.

speaker: LUCY
line: There’s nothing I can do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy ….

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait here a second, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s going on?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: We’re here to arrest Lucy Householder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: I think you know why, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell is happening?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the blood on Lucy’s uniform was an exact DNA match. Lucy was covered in Amy Jacobs’ blood.

speaker: MULDER
line: She didn’t do it, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s incontrovertible evidence.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Agent Mulder. Where is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was just here.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Well, she’s gone now.

speaker: AMY
line: Please. I’m – I’m thirsty.

speaker: WADE
line: You shouldn’t have run. I was taking care of you.. I thought you understood that. Why did you run away?

speaker: AMY
line: Please, Mister. I need some water.

speaker: WADE
line: You shouldn’t have run!

speaker: AMY
line: Please. I’m so thirsty.

speaker: AMY
line: I want my mom. I don’t want to die here. Please. Please, Mister! Don’t let me die!

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re going to drive her away with this.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: She’s been driven away, Agent Mulder. I’m trying to find her.

speaker: MULDER
line: A half a dozen witnesses placed her across town at the time of the kidnapping.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: I’m well aware of the facts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then trust me on this. She’s not working with Wade.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: How did she get the blood on her?

speaker: MULDER
line: She may have bled it.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: She bled Amy Jacobs’ blood?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. It may explain why there was so little of it on the carpet in Amy’s bedroom.

speaker: AGENT KRESGE
line: Agent Eubanks, line three.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: I don’t have time for this nonsense, Agent Mulder. We’ve got a young girl’s life at stake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I hate to say this, Mulder, but I think you just ran out of credibility.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s wrong, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are protecting her beyond the point of reason.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m protecting her because I think she’s connected to Amy Jacobs, just not the way everybody else thinks she is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you consider for one minute that the person she’s connected to is Carl Wade?

speaker: MULDER
line: Carl Wade? Why would she be connected with Carl Wade?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For the same twisted reason that abused children crave their parents’ love or hostages develop sympathy for their captors. I mean, maybe Lucy developed some kind of emotional dependency.

speaker: MULDER
line: After five years in a dark pit, I’m sure she developed some kind of connection with Wade, just not the kind that you’re suggesting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It makes a lot more sense than the notion that she’s bleeding Amy Jacobs’ blood.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know how to explain it, but I think that Wade’s abduction of Amy triggered some kind of physical response in Lucy – some kind of empathic transference.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you can’t ----

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s how I account for what Lucy’s going through. That’s how I account for the identical words that corresponded to Amy, and the spontaneous wounds and blood, as well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why did she run? If she’s innocent, what was she running from?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because she’s afraid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don’t see what you’re doing, do you, Mulder? You are so close to this that you just don’t see it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What don’t I see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The extreme rationalization that’s going on. Your personal identification with the victim, or in this case, the suspect. You’re becoming an empath yourself, Mulder. You are so sympathetic to Lucy as a victim like *your sister* that you can’t see her as a person who’s capable of committing this crime.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t think I’ve thought of that? I have. And not everything I do, say, think, and feel goes back to my sister. You, of all people should realize that sometimes motivations for behavior can be more complex and mysterious than tracing them back to one single childhood experience.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Agent Mulder. We’ve got a man on the way in who’s spotted Wade.

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Yeah, that’s the guy. I offered to fix his flat. Tried to do the guy a favor and he went wacko on me. Started freaking the minute I got out of my truck.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the girl? Was she with him?

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: I didn’t see anyone else. Guess she could have been in the trunk.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Can you give us an exact spot?

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: Yeah.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Right in the middle of nowhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which way was the car headed?

speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
line: West.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, Interstate 12… county 15 north … 903…. look at this. Right off the 903.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Easton?

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s where Lucy was found 17 years ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s a small town, Scully. Somebody’s bound to know Wade’s face. Know where he lives.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But we already stick out like a sore thumb, Mulder. If we start canvassing Main Street somebody’s going to pick up the phone to him.

speaker: MULDER
line: But he’s a photographer, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: He should have an account here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Amy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s happening? Did you find her?

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Where are they, Lucy? Tell us where Wade took Amy.

speaker: LUCY
line: I don’t know.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Anything happens to that girl and you’ll be tried as an accomplice. Were they here when you arrived?

speaker: LUCY
line: No.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: You haven’t seen them? You haven’t spoken with them?

speaker: LUCY
line: I said no.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Then why are you here?

speaker: LUCY
line: I don’t know.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Just showed up for no reason in particular? That’s what you ask us to believe?

speaker: LUCY
line: I’ve been here before. A long time ago. That was where he kept me.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: So why are you here now? Take her outside and place her in custody.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I’ll take her. Come on, Lucy.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Agent ---

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s all right.

speaker: LUCY
line: He hasn’t touched her. Not yet. He wants to, but he can’t. That’s why he takes the pictures.

speaker: MULDER
line: What else, Lucy? Tell me what else?

speaker: LUCY
line: If he can’t have her all to himself that’s when he’s dangerous. That’s when he’ll start hurting her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy, you came here to help her.

speaker: LUCY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why else would you come back here if not for Amy? You’re sharing her pain.

speaker: LUCY
line: I can’t …

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re the survivor. You’re the strong one. Now Amy needs some of your strength.

speaker: LUCY
line: She’s not going to make it.

speaker: MULDER
line: She has to make it and you have to help her.

speaker: LUCY
line: She’s cold. She’s cold and, and wet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lucy, Lucy, sit down. Sit down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. They found Wade’s car north of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: They’re in the water.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s a river near here. I think that’s where they are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But the river’s east and they found Wade’s car a mile north.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wade lives here. He knows these woods. He could be doubling back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did she tell you that?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but I think that’s what she’s trying to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, wait!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stay with her and get word to Eubanks that Wade may be heading towards the river.

speaker: AMY
line: Please! Stop! I can’t!

speaker: WADE
line: Come on! They’re coming!

speaker: AMY
line: I can’t! Please!

speaker: WADE
line: Nobody …. Nobody’s going to spoil us.

speaker: AMY
line: No!

speaker: AGENT KRESGE
line: Can you sit up? Can you breathe? Are you able to breathe?

speaker: AGENT KRESGE
line: This is Agent Kresge. I’ve got what looks like an emergency situation. Requesting EMS, over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wade! Federal Officer! Hold it right there!

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s not breathing. No pulse either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: One … two… three…. four…. wet, staring blankly. Her chest suddenly rises. AGENT KRESGE is with her, also performing CPR, but LUCY is in sync with MULDER.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: One … two… three…. four….

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Amy, breathe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: …two… three…. four…five.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s nothing. Mulder, it’s no good. I’m sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Damn it, Amy, come on!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, stop. You can’t help her. Mulder. It’s no use. Mulder. Mulder, stop it. Stop it. Mulder, stop!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. She’s breathing.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: Have you got her? Is that her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, we got her. We have to get an EMS unit here right away with some heat and some oxygen.

speaker: AGENT EUBANKS
line: They’re close. We’ve got them up at Wade’s place right now. They’re working on Lucy Householder.

speaker: AMY
line: I’m cold. I want to go home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s getting dark. We have to get her off the river.

speaker: AGENT KRESGE
line: I don’t know what happened. She just started coughing, then she couldn’t breathe. By the time the EMS guys got here she was already gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s Amy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s exhausted, but it looks like she’s going to be fine. The doctors want to keep her for a day or two just to be sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: How serious were her injuries?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wade must have left her alone. There were no injuries.

speaker: MULDER
line: He must have dragged her through the woods for at least a mile.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know, Mulder. I can’t explain it. She didn’t have a cut on her and nobody wants to talk about that right now. Everyone’s just relieved to have her back again – to have her safe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did they finish up on Lucy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. They, uh … they brought in the State Pathologist last night so I stopped by to get the autopsy reports on my way.

speaker: MULDER
line: She drowned, didn’t she?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They found five liters of water in her lungs.

speaker: MULDER
line: She saved Amy’s life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder … Whatever there was between them, you were part of that connection. Did you think about that? Lucy may have died for Amy, but without you, they never would have found her.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she died for more than Amy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think finally, it was … the only way she could escape. The only way she could forget what happened 17 years ago. Finally, the only way she could outrun Carl Wade.
